titleStmt.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to James D. Porter, September 30, 1887

bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to James D. Porter
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p:
Consulate of the United States
St Paul de Loanda
30th September 1887.

Mr Newton
To the Department of State
Advising an enclosure consisting of an extract from the "Bulletim Official", and translation of the same, giving notice of alterations &c in lights on the SW Coast of Africa.

Consulate of the United States
St Paul de Loanda
30th September 1887

The Honorable Assistant Secretary of State
Washington

I have the honour to transmit herewith, together with a translation, printed copy of a notice published in the Bulletim Official of Loanda of 24th September, giving particulars of a new light erected on St Felippes Bonnet at the Port of Benguella, and to be exhibited on and after the 16th October next
A new light is also being erected at the Port of Ambriz, and another at Point Palmarinas of which I will send due notice as soon as they are officially published in the Bulletim.

I am, Sir
Your obedient servant
Robt S. Newton
Vice Consul
Enclosure No 1. Copy of Notice to Mariners
